input_text:
Job Title: Building Maintenance Specialist

Location: Bismarck, ND

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: General Business, Other

Description:
Overview: The building maintenance team is responsible for grounds maintenance and building upkeep for our Bismarck Location. If you are highly motivated and have previous maintenance experience, read the job description below and apply today!
Responsibilities:Performs daily, weekly, monthly, and annual facility inspections.Coordinates, monitors, and facilitates contracted professional services for scheduled maintenance, repairs, and special projects.Maintains a building maintenance log of scheduled maintenance services and inspectionsGround maintenance to include: Mowing, trimming, and maintaining lawn, Sprinkler system maintenance and repairSnow removalYard clean-up and sweepingMaintain exterior lightingGeneral yard dutiesBuilding upkeep to include:Obtain quotes and serves as liaison with any contracted servicePaintingMaintain building roof, roof vents, exhaust fans and HVAC systemsMaintain interior lightingMaintain walk thru and overhead doorsMaintain and pump out wash bay pits as neededAssist maintaining some common areas like tools rooms, etc. as needed.Over sees remodeling projects and workstation restructuringAbility to conduct basic mechanical, electrical, carpentry and facility service and repairs.Assists the departments with cleaning/contamination control as neededEventsSets up and tears down for training, meetings, and eventsMaintains a set up and tear down planning worksheet for each event.Works with purchasing agents to evaluate and maintain consistent purchasing practicesWorks within and promotes vision, mission, and values of BMC.Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:Requires mechanical knowledge, experience using heavy equipment, basic knowledge of HVAC, heating, and plumbing systems and the software to run it.Computer skills required.Good communication skillsPrevious maintenance experience preferred.This candidate should be a self-starter who can work flexible hours as needed for snow removal, lot sweeping and special projects.The physical requirements of this position include:Shoveling snowClimbing laddersSnow removal equipment operationLifting up to 70 poundsWorking at heights of approximately 50 feet
 As a family business for three generations, we currently employ over 900 associates in 20 locations throughout North Dakota, South Dakota, Montana, and Nebraska. We are looking for self-motivated, forward-thinking individuals to join us in our continued success. 
If you desire to start your career with our team, here are some things we offer within our full benefits package: 10% Annual Retirement Employer Contribution, with Additional 5% Discretionary Employer ContributionHealth Insurance – 4 plan options including 3 High Deductible plans Health Savings Account (with High Deductible plan options) – Employer contribution up to $1,100/year Flexible Benefit PlansDental Insurance – 2 plan options Vision InsuranceBasic Life/AD&D and Supplemental Life InsuranceEmployer paid Short-Term Disability Coverage – 60% of base pay/salaryLong-Term Disability Coverage Maternity / Paternity BenefitsHolidaysPaid Time Off (PTO)401(K) PlanEmployee Assistance Program (EAP) – including Health Coaching SmartDollar – employer paid financial planning program Legal Shield/ID Shield products AFLAC options - Cancer Insurance/Accident/Hospitalization/Short Term Disability 
 Candidates must have valid work authorization and be able to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship.
EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability
#LI-Onsite

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Building Maintenance Specialist
output_json.summary: The building maintenance team is responsible for grounds maintenance and building upkeep for our Bismarck Location.
job_responsibilities: Performs daily, weekly, monthly, and annual facility inspections.
Coordinates, monitors, and facilitates contracted professional services for scheduled maintenance, repairs, and special projects.
Maintains a building maintenance log of scheduled maintenance services and inspections
Ground maintenance to include: Mowing, trimming, and maintaining lawn, Sprinkler system maintenance and repair
Snow removal
Yard clean-up and sweeping
Maintain exterior lighting
General yard duties
Building upkeep to include:
Obtain quotes and serves as liaison with any contracted service
Painting
Maintain building roof, roof vents, exhaust fans and HVAC systems
Maintain interior lighting
Maintain walk thru and overhead doors
Maintain and pump out wash bay pits as needed
Assist maintaining some common areas like tools rooms, etc. as needed.
Over sees remodeling projects and workstation restructuring
Ability to conduct basic mechanical, electrical, carpentry and facility service and repairs
Assists the departments with cleaning/contamination control as needed
Events
Sets up and tears down for training, meetings, and events
Maintains a set up and tear down planning worksheet for each event
Works with purchasing agents to evaluate and maintain consistent purchasing practices
Works within and promotes vision, mission, and values of BMC
Performs other duties as assigned
output_json.physical_requirements: Shoveling snow, Climbing ladders, Snow removal equipment operation, Lifting up to 70 pounds, Working at heights of approximately 50 feet
benefits: 10% Annual Retirement Employer Contribution, with Additional 5% Discretionary Employer Contribution
Health Insurance – 4 plan options including 3 High Deductible plans
Health Savings Account (with High Deductible plan options) – Employer contribution up to $1,100/year
Basic Life/AD&D and Supplemental Life Insurance
Employer paid Short-Term Disability Coverage – 60% of base pay/salary
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) – including Health Coaching
SmartDollar – employer paid financial planning program
AFLAC options - Cancer Insurance/Accident/Hospitalization/Short Term Disability
output_json.company_information: As a family business for three generations, we currently employ over 900 associates in 20 locations throughout North Dakota, South Dakota, Montana, and Nebraska.
